definition: to step across/to stride over/to straddle/to span
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: The little tailor stepped up and bowed.
The player should learn to use a cross over step to recover from wide balls.
sentences.chinese: 選手應學習在回擊大外角球來球后，以交叉跨步回防。

sentences.english: A solider stepped in, dressed in a long coat.
sentences.chinese: 一個士兵跨步進來，他穿着一件長外套。

sentences.english: Lunge forward and hold the lunge, pulsing for 16 reps.
sentences.chinese: 向前跨步，保持姿勢，身體再緩慢上下16次。

sentences.english: Still, big strides have been made with achievement visible to every fair-minded person.
sentences.chinese: 仍然，每個公正的人都可以看到大跨步發展的成就。

sentences.english: Through shortening your stride and eliminating overextending, you should be able to keep your feet directly underneath you at all times.
sentences.chinese: 縮短你的跨步，就可以讓腳在身體正下方落地。

sentences.english: He took his debut in his stride, didn't he?
sentences.chinese: 他把握住了首秀的機會，大跨步的前進，對吧？

sentences.english: And to this stride I had got accustomed.
sentences.chinese: 對於這種大跨步，我已經習慣了。

sentences.english: A horse snorts before stepping forward.
sentences.chinese: 一匹馬噴着鼻息然後跨步。

definition: stride/to step (on the spot)/to mark time/at a standstill
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
